content.raw: I guess my main concern is not so much the change in behavior after rebuild because if you rebuild against a newly released ign-physics, it's not too surprising to have new behavior. Instead my concern is, we fix a bug in a header file implementation and make a release of ign-physics, but users don't get the fix unless they rebuild. ign-gazebo users that install from debs won't get the fix because even though they have a new ign-physics deb, they won't have an ign-gazebo that has been built against the new changes. Maybe the solution is to make a patch release of dependee packages when we make a release of ign-physics where the changes are in headers.
